title: Vi vs Lee Sin 7.3

embed.description: Greetings, Summoners. Welcome to patch 7.3 - the one where we react (mostly) to professional play. That's not to say that everything below is for the pros, but with major competitive play in full swing across all regions, we've had enough time to properly react to many of the trends we're seeing.

body:
Preemptive Warning: Fatigue induced salt incoming.

Taken from Riot's 7.3 patch notes...

Vi
Movement speed and base attack speed reduced.
2017’s jungle has proven pretty favorable for Vi, even with one or her stronger keystones being nerfed. As such, we’re taking this opportunity to go under the hood and retune her base stats to be more in line with others in her weight class. For a champion with a two-charge attack reset and two gap-closers, her base movement and attack speeds were a touch out of line. The only thing that should be excessive about Vi is her force.
Base Stats
MOVEMENT SPEED 345 ⇒ 340
BASE ATTACK SPEED 0.644 ⇒ 0.625

Taken from League of Legends Wikipedia...

Lee Sin Movespeed: 350
Lee Sin Attackspeed: 0.651  (+ 0 – 51%)

This is despite the fact that Lee Sin also has two gapclosers and an attack speed steroid passive in his kit. This next bit is anecdotal but still worth mentioning, Lee Sin's traditional weakness (lategame) doesn't really exist anymore as games simply do not generally last that long, as shown here: 
http://www.leagueofgraphs.com/rankings/game-durations

So if Vi's base movement speed and attack speeds are a touch out of line, what are Lee Sin's?

replies.body: Vi is currently overpowered. The state of Lee Sin has nothing to do with the healthiness of another champion.

I'm sorry but no. Vi isn't overpowered. **The game changed around her**.

So, of course, when CotC gets reworked/removed and the jungle changes to leave Vi in a shitty spot, she'll be successfully sejuani'd. Of course the boards doesn't care because she's not a tank.

Just becuase the game changed around her doesnt mean she isn't stronger than the rest of the pack.  If someone dies in my family  and leaves me a billion dollars,  I'm a billionaire.  If I make a billion dollars on my own,  I'm a billionaire.  

Doesn't matter two shits about how it came to be,  it is what it is.  Vi is strong regardless of how she got to be there.  

Tbh I commend riots approach to balancing vi.   They realize they have a pretty well designed champion that is only in flavor because of the meta game shift (even if it is thier own damned fault). Rather than gutting her and putting her on the bench they're trying to fine tune some outlying details to bring her in line with everyone else. Shame they don't do this with everyone.

> [{quoted}](name=CaptainMårvelous,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=EdB6gBPd,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2017-02-08T01:07:40.941+0000)
>
> I'm sorry but no. Vi isn't overpowered. **The game changed around her**.
> 

That doesn't mean she isn't overpowered, that means changes to the game made her overpowered. You're arguing semantics.

No, this isn't semantics at all.

If a champion isn't really all that strong and then suddenly becomes strong _because the game changed_, you don't nerf the champion. We've discussed this before. It's why the term "Sejuani'd" exists. It's why after they change the game (again), Vi is going to be in a worse state and in need of either reversions or buffs.

If Riot would revert stuff should the game change? Sure, it'd be fine with that. But they're not. It's a classic case of nerf the champ, remove the thing and then leave the champ in a worse state. It's disgusting that we'll get up in arms over Sejuani but not other champions because other champs aren't tanks.

It's disgusting that we'll get up in arms over Sejuani but not other champions because other champs aren't tanks.

Ridiculous nonsense. Riot doesn't *plan* on reverting game mechanics when they implement them in the first place. Riot didn't *plan* on nerfing cinderhulk when they implemented it, knowing in advance that Sejuani and other champs were going to abuse the shit out of it- just like they didn't *plan* on removing devourer when they put it in the game.

So as far as Riot is concerned CotC is here to stay, and going by the latest PBE notes they don't plan on touching it for awhile, if ever again. Thus your tacit implication that instead of addressing the specific outliers (in this case, Vi) they should instead attack the tool being abused (in this case CotC) and making it weaker for everyone else that uses it in addition to Vi, is dumb. The hyper-majority of champions that use the same game mechanics that Vi uses (CotC, the new jungle changes etc) are fairly healthy. Punishing *all* of them instead of the small handful of abusers is nonsensical.

>Ridiculous nonsense. Riot doesn't plan on reverting game mechanics when they implement them in the first place. Riot didn't plan on nerfing cinderhulk when they implemented it, knowing in advance that Sejuani and other champs were going to abuse the shit out of it- just like they didn't plan on removing devourer when they put it in the game.

Of course you don't plan on it. That doesn't mean you don't alter things when they do change. Did you know Nocturne had his ult range reverted several patches ago to what it was on-release and subsequently nerfed? Because _the game changed around Nocturne and new releases made his original ult more in-line_. I wouldn't care nearly as much if Riot reverted things after the game changes. But they don't in the majority of situations.

>So as far as Riot is concerned CotC is here to stay, and going by the latest PBE notes they don't plan on touching it for awhile, if ever again. Thus your tacit implication that instead of addressing the specific outliers (in this case, Vi) they should instead attack the tool being abused (in this case CotC) and making it weaker for everyone else that uses it in addition to Vi, is dumb. The hyper-majority of champions that use the same game mechanics that Vi uses (CotC, the new jungle changes etc) are fairly healthy. Punishing all of them instead of the small handful of abusers is nonsensical.

Warlords.
Fervor.
Thunderlords.
Any number of jungle items from previous seasons.

Sejuani and Sion got nerfed because Cinderhulk was "here to stay". Other junglers in the previous season got nerfed because SotA was "Here to stay". Pardon my skepticism but for a balance team that argues about things being a permanent addition, a lot of them aren't. Hell, we already heard rumors that they want to expand mastery trees further and divert them from three-to-five. Do you think Vi will get stuff back when the game changes around her? Do you think Sejuani has received even momentary buffs due to Cinderhulk's changes leaving her in a weaker spot?

Again: This is something repeated over and over. But when it's a damage dealer it's ok to happen (Vi is the latest in a long line of damage-dealing champs abusing something defensive) but god forbid it's a tank, otherwise we invent the term Sejuani to make sure that this never happens again...~~at least to tanks because tanks are precious babies who must be protected and bottlefed~~.
